property.description: The maximum number of application attempts. It's a global setting for all application masters. Each application master can specify its individual maximum number of application attempts via the API, but the individual number cannot be more than the global upper bound. If it is, the resourcemanager will override it. The default number is set to 2, to allow at least one retry for AM.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.am.max-attempts

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.webapp.cross-origin.enabled

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.nodes.exclude-path

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.resource-tracker.client.thread-count

property.description: The class to use as the resource scheduler.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.class

property.description: The minimum allocation for every container request at the RM in MBs. Memory requests lower than this will be set to the value of this property. Additionally, a node manager that is configured to have less memory than this value will be shut down by the resource manager.
property.name: yarn.scheduler.minimum-allocation-mb

property.description: The maximum allocation for every container request at the RM in MBs. Memory requests higher than this will throw an InvalidResourceRequestException.
property.name: yarn.scheduler.maximum-allocation-mb

property.description: The minimum allocation for every container request at the RM in terms of virtual CPU cores. Requests lower than this will be set to the value of this property. Additionally, a node manager that is configured to have fewer virtual cores than this value will be shut down by the resource manager.
property.name: yarn.scheduler.minimum-allocation-vcores

property.description: The maximum allocation for every container request at the RM in terms of virtual CPU cores. Requests higher than this will throw an InvalidResourceRequestException.
property.name: yarn.scheduler.maximum-allocation-vcores

property.description: Used by node labels. If set to true, the port should be included in the node name. Only usable if your scheduler supports node labels.
property.name: yarn.scheduler.include-port-in-node-name

property.description: Enable RM to recover state after starting. If true, then yarn.resourcemanager.store.class must be specified.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.recovery.enabled

property.description: Should RM fail fast if it encounters any errors. By defalt, it points to ${yarn.fail-fast}. Errors include: 1) exceptions when state-store write/read operations fails.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.fail-fast

property.description: Should YARN fail fast if it encounters any errors. This is a global config for all other components including RM,NM etc. If no value is set for component-specific config (e.g yarn.resourcemanager.fail-fast), this value will be the default.
property.name: yarn.fail-fast

property.description: Enable RM work preserving recovery. This configuration is private to YARN for experimenting the feature.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.work-preserving-recovery.enabled

property.description: Set the amount of time RM waits before allocating new containers on work-preserving-recovery. Such wait period gives RM a chance to settle down resyncing with NMs in the cluster on recovery, before assigning new containers to applications.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.work-preserving-recovery.scheduling-wait-ms

property.description:
The class to use as the persistent store.
If org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.recovery.ZKRMStateStore is used, the store is implicitly fenced; meaning a single ResourceManager is able to use the store at any point in time. More details on this implicit fencing, along with setting up appropriate ACLs is discussed under yarn.resourcemanager.zk-state-store.root-node.acl.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.store.class

property.description: When automatic failover is enabled, number of zookeeper operation retry times in ActiveStandbyElector
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.ha.failover-controller.active-standby-elector.zk.retries

property.description: The maximum number of completed applications RM state store keeps, less than or equals to ${yarn.resourcemanager.max-completed-applications}. By default, it equals to ${yarn.resourcemanager.max-completed-applications}. This ensures that the applications kept in the state store are consistent with the applications remembered in RM memory. Any values larger than ${yarn.resourcemanager.max-completed-applications} will be reset to ${yarn.resourcemanager.max-completed-applications}. Note that this value impacts the RM recovery performance.Typically, a smaller value indicates better performance on RM recovery.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.state-store.max-completed-applications

property.description: Full path of the ZooKeeper znode where RM state will be stored. This must be supplied when using org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.recovery.ZKRMStateStore as the value for yarn.resourcemanager.store.class
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.zk-state-store.parent-path

property.description:
ACLs to be used for the root znode when using ZKRMStateStore in an HA scenario for fencing.
ZKRMStateStore supports implicit fencing to allow a single ResourceManager write-access to the store. For fencing, the ResourceManagers in the cluster share read-write-admin privileges on the root node, but the Active ResourceManager claims exclusive create-delete permissions.
By default, when this property is not set, we use the ACLs from yarn.resourcemanager.zk-acl for shared admin access and rm-address:random-number for username-based exclusive create-delete access.
This property allows users to set ACLs of their choice instead of using the default mechanism. For fencing to work, the ACLs should be carefully set differently on each ResourceManger such that all the ResourceManagers have shared admin access and the Active ResourceManger takes over (exclusively) the create-delete access.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.zk-state-store.root-node.acl

property.description: URI pointing to the location of the FileSystem path where RM state will be stored. This must be supplied when using org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.recovery.FileSystemRMStateStore as the value for yarn.resourcemanager.store.class
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.fs.state-store.uri

property.description: hdfs client retry policy specification. hdfs client retry is always enabled. Specified in pairs of sleep-time and number-of-retries and (t0, n0), (t1, n1), ..., the first n0 retries sleep t0 milliseconds on average, the following n1 retries sleep t1 milliseconds on average, and so on.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.fs.state-store.retry-policy-spec

property.description: the number of retries to recover from IOException in FileSystemRMStateStore.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.fs.state-store.num-retries

property.description: Retry interval in milliseconds in FileSystemRMStateStore.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.fs.state-store.retry-interval-ms

property.description: Local path where the RM state will be stored when using org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.recovery.LeveldbRMStateStore as the value for yarn.resourcemanager.store.class
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.leveldb-state-store.path

property.description: The time in seconds between full compactions of the leveldb database. Setting the interval to zero disables the full compaction cycles.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.leveldb-state-store.compaction-interval-secs

property.description: Enable RM high-availability. When enabled, (1) The RM starts in the Standby mode by default, and transitions to the Active mode when prompted to. (2) The nodes in the RM ensemble are listed in yarn.resourcemanager.ha.rm-ids (3) The id of each RM either comes from yarn.resourcemanager.ha.id if yarn.resourcemanager.ha.id is explicitly specified or can be figured out by matching yarn.resourcemanager.address.{id} with local address (4) The actual physical addresses come from the configs of the pattern - {rpc-config}.{id}
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.ha.enabled

property.description: Enable automatic failover. By default, it is enabled only when HA is enabled
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.ha.automatic-failover.enabled

property.description: Enable embedded automatic failover. By default, it is enabled only when HA is enabled. The embedded elector relies on the RM state store to handle fencing, and is primarily intended to be used in conjunction with ZKRMStateStore.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.ha.automatic-failover.embedded

property.description: The base znode path to use for storing leader information, when using ZooKeeper based leader election.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.ha.automatic-failover.zk-base-path

property.description: Index at which last section of application id (with each section separated by _ in application id) will be split so that application znode stored in zookeeper RM state store will be stored as two different znodes (parent-child). Split is done from the end. For instance, with no split, appid znode will be of the form application_1352994193343_0001. If the value of this config is 1, the appid znode will be broken into two parts application_1352994193343_000 and 1 respectively with former being the parent node. application_1352994193343_0002 will then be stored as 2 under the parent node application_1352994193343_000. This config can take values from 0 to 4. 0 means there will be no split. If configuration value is outside this range, it will be treated as config value of 0(i.e. no split). A value larger than 0 (up to 4) should be configured if you are storing a large number of apps in ZK based RM state store and state store operations are failing due to LenError in Zookeeper.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.zk-appid-node.split-index

property.description: Index at which the RM Delegation Token ids will be split so that the delegation token znodes stored in the zookeeper RM state store will be stored as two different znodes (parent-child). The split is done from the end. For instance, with no split, a delegation token znode will be of the form RMDelegationToken_123456789. If the value of this config is 1, the delegation token znode will be broken into two parts: RMDelegationToken_12345678 and 9 respectively with former being the parent node. This config can take values from 0 to 4. 0 means there will be no split. If the value is outside this range, it will be treated as 0 (i.e. no split). A value larger than 0 (up to 4) should be configured if you are running a large number of applications, with long-lived delegation tokens and state store operations (e.g. failover) are failing due to LenError in Zookeeper.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.zk-delegation-token-node.split-index

property.description: Specifies the maximum size of the data that can be stored in a znode. Value should be same or less than jute.maxbuffer configured in zookeeper. Default value configured is 1MB.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.zk-max-znode-size.bytes

property.description: Name of the cluster. In a HA setting, this is used to ensure the RM participates in leader election for this cluster and ensures it does not affect other clusters
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.cluster-id

property.description: The list of RM nodes in the cluster when HA is enabled. See description of yarn.resourcemanager.ha .enabled for full details on how this is used.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.ha.rm-ids

property.description: The id (string) of the current RM. When HA is enabled, this is an optional config. The id of current RM can be set by explicitly specifying yarn.resourcemanager.ha.id or figured out by matching yarn.resourcemanager.address.{id} with local address See description of yarn.resourcemanager.ha.enabled for full details on how this is used.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.ha.id

property.description: When HA is enabled, the class to be used by Clients, AMs and NMs to failover to the Active RM. It should extend org.apache.hadoop.yarn.client.RMFailoverProxyProvider
property.name: yarn.client.failover-proxy-provider

property.description: When HA is enabled, the max number of times FailoverProxyProvider should attempt failover. When set, this overrides the yarn.resourcemanager.connect.max-wait.ms. When not set, this is inferred from yarn.resourcemanager.connect.max-wait.ms.
property.name: yarn.client.failover-max-attempts

property.description: When HA is enabled, the sleep base (in milliseconds) to be used for calculating the exponential delay between failovers. When set, this overrides the yarn.resourcemanager.connect.* settings. When not set, yarn.resourcemanager.connect.retry-interval.ms is used instead.
property.name: yarn.client.failover-sleep-base-ms

property.description: When HA is enabled, the maximum sleep time (in milliseconds) between failovers. When set, this overrides the yarn.resourcemanager.connect.* settings. When not set, yarn.resourcemanager.connect.retry-interval.ms is used instead.
property.name: yarn.client.failover-sleep-max-ms

property.description: When HA is enabled, the number of retries per attempt to connect to a ResourceManager. In other words, it is the ipc.client.connect.max.retries to be used during failover attempts
property.name: yarn.client.failover-retries

property.description: When HA is enabled, the number of retries per attempt to connect to a ResourceManager on socket timeouts. In other words, it is the ipc.client.connect.max.retries.on.timeouts to be used during failover attempts
property.name: yarn.client.failover-retries-on-socket-timeouts

property.description: The maximum number of completed applications RM keeps.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.max-completed-applications

property.description: Interval at which the delayed token removal thread runs
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.delayed.delegation-token.removal-interval-ms

property.description: Maximum size in bytes for configurations that can be provided by application to RM for delegation token renewal. By experiment, it's roughly 128 bytes per key-value pair. The default value 12800 allows roughly 100 configs, may be less.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.delegation-token.max-conf-size-bytes

property.description: If true, ResourceManager will have proxy-user privileges. Use case: In a secure cluster, YARN requires the user hdfs delegation-tokens to do localization and log-aggregation on behalf of the user. If this is set to true, ResourceManager is able to request new hdfs delegation tokens on behalf of the user. This is needed by long-running-service, because the hdfs tokens will eventually expire and YARN requires new valid tokens to do localization and log-aggregation. Note that to enable this use case, the corresponding HDFS NameNode has to configure ResourceManager as the proxy-user so that ResourceManager can itself ask for new tokens on behalf of the user when tokens are past their max-life-time.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.proxy-user-privileges.enabled

property.description: Interval for the roll over for the master key used to generate application tokens
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.am-rm-tokens.master-key-rolling-interval-secs

property.description: Interval for the roll over for the master key used to generate container tokens. It is expected to be much greater than yarn.nm.liveness-monitor.expiry-interval-ms and yarn.resourcemanager.rm.container-allocation.expiry-interval-ms. Otherwise the behavior is undefined.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.container-tokens.master-key-rolling-interval-secs

property.description: The heart-beat interval in milliseconds for every NodeManager in the cluster.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.nodemanagers.heartbeat-interval-ms

property.description: The minimum allowed version of a connecting nodemanager. The valid values are NONE (no version checking), EqualToRM (the nodemanager's version is equal to or greater than the RM version), or a Version String.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.nodemanager.minimum.version

property.description: Enable a set of periodic monitors (specified in yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.monitor.policies) that affect the scheduler.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.monitor.enable

property.description: The list of SchedulingEditPolicy classes that interact with the scheduler. A particular module may be incompatible with the scheduler, other policies, or a configuration of either.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.monitor.policies

property.description: The class to use as the configuration provider. If org.apache.hadoop.yarn.LocalConfigurationProvider is used, the local configuration will be loaded. If org.apache.hadoop.yarn.FileSystemBasedConfigurationProvider is used, the configuration which will be loaded should be uploaded to remote File system first.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.configuration.provider-class

property.description: The value specifies the file system (e.g. HDFS) path where ResourceManager loads configuration if yarn.resourcemanager.configuration.provider-class is set to org.apache.hadoop.yarn.FileSystemBasedConfigurationProvider.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.configuration.file-system-based-store

property.description: The setting that controls whether yarn system metrics is published to the Timeline server (version one) or not, by RM. This configuration is now deprecated in favor of yarn.system-metrics-publisher.enabled.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.system-metrics-publisher.enabled

property.description: The setting that controls whether yarn system metrics is published on the Timeline service or not by RM And NM.
property.name: yarn.system-metrics-publisher.enabled

property.description: The setting that controls whether yarn container events are published to the timeline service or not by RM. This configuration setting is for ATS V2.
property.name: yarn.rm.system-metrics-publisher.emit-container-events

property.description: Number of worker threads that send the yarn system metrics data.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.system-metrics-publisher.dispatcher.pool-size

property.description: Number of diagnostics/failure messages can be saved in RM for log aggregation. It also defines the number of diagnostics/failure messages can be shown in log aggregation web ui.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.max-log-aggregation-diagnostics-in-memory

property.description: RM DelegationTokenRenewer thread count
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.delegation-token-renewer.thread-count

property.description: RM secret key update interval in ms
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.delegation.key.update-interval

property.description: RM delegation token maximum lifetime in ms
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.delegation.token.max-lifetime

property.description: RM delegation token update interval in ms
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.delegation.token.renew-interval

property.description: Thread pool size for RMApplicationHistoryWriter.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.history-writer.multi-threaded-dispatcher.pool-size

property.description: Comma-separated list of values (in minutes) for schedule queue related metrics.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.metrics.runtime.buckets

property.description: Interval for the roll over for the master key used to generate NodeManager tokens. It is expected to be set to a value much larger than yarn.nm.liveness-monitor.expiry-interval-ms.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.nm-tokens.master-key-rolling-interval-secs

property.description: Flag to enable the ResourceManager reservation system.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.reservation-system.enable

property.description: The Java class to use as the ResourceManager reservation system. By default, is set to org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.reservation.CapacityReservationSystem when using CapacityScheduler and is set to org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.reservation.FairReservationSystem when using FairScheduler.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.reservation-system.class

property.description: The plan follower policy class name to use for the ResourceManager reservation system. By default, is set to org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.reservation.CapacitySchedulerPlanFollower is used when using CapacityScheduler, and is set to org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.reservation.FairSchedulerPlanFollower when using FairScheduler.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.reservation-system.plan.follower

property.description: Step size of the reservation system in ms
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.reservation-system.planfollower.time-step

property.description: The expiry interval for a container
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.rm.container-allocation.expiry-interval-ms

property.description: The hostname of the NM.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.hostname

property.description: The address of the container manager in the NM.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.address

property.description: The actual address the server will bind to. If this optional address is set, the RPC and webapp servers will bind to this address and the port specified in yarn.nodemanager.address and yarn.nodemanager.webapp.address, respectively. This is most useful for making NM listen to all interfaces by setting to 0.0.0.0.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.bind-host

property.description: Environment variables that should be forwarded from the NodeManager's environment to the container's.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.admin-env

property.description: Environment variables that containers may override rather than use NodeManager's default.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.env-whitelist

property.description: who will execute(launch) the containers.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-executor.class

property.description: Comma separated List of container state transition listeners.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-state-transition-listener.classes

property.description: Number of threads container manager uses.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-manager.thread-count

property.description: Number of threads collector service uses.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.collector-service.thread-count

property.description: Number of threads used in cleanup.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.delete.thread-count

property.description: Max number of OPPORTUNISTIC containers to queue at the nodemanager.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.opportunistic-containers-max-queue-length

property.description:
Number of seconds after an application finishes before the nodemanager's DeletionService will delete the application's localized file directory and log directory.
To diagnose YARN application problems, set this property's value large enough (for example, to 600 = 10 minutes) to permit examination of these directories. After changing the property's value, you must restart the nodemanager in order for it to have an effect.
The roots of YARN applications' work directories is configurable with the yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs property (see below), and the roots of the YARN applications' log directories is configurable with the yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs property (see also below).
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.delete.debug-delay-sec

property.description: Keytab for NM.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.keytab

property.description: List of directories to store localized files in. An application's localized file directory will be found in: ${yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs}/usercache/${user}/appcache/application_${appid}. Individual containers' work directories, called container_${contid}, will be subdirectories of this.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs

property.description: It limits the maximum number of files which will be localized in a single local directory. If the limit is reached then sub-directories will be created and new files will be localized in them. If it is set to a value less than or equal to 36 [which are sub-directories (0-9 and then a-z)] then NodeManager will fail to start. For example; [for public cache] if this is configured with a value of 40 ( 4 files + 36 sub-directories) and the local-dir is "/tmp/local-dir1" then it will allow 4 files to be created directly inside "/tmp/local-dir1/filecache". For files that are localized further it will create a sub-directory "0" inside "/tmp/local-dir1/filecache" and will localize files inside it until it becomes full. If a file is removed from a sub-directory that is marked full, then that sub-directory will be used back again to localize files.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.local-cache.max-files-per-directory

property.description: Address where the localizer IPC is.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.localizer.address

property.description: Address where the collector service IPC is.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.collector-service.address

property.description: Interval in between cache cleanups.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.localizer.cache.cleanup.interval-ms

property.description: Target size of localizer cache in MB, per nodemanager. It is a target retention size that only includes resources with PUBLIC and PRIVATE visibility and excludes resources with APPLICATION visibility
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.localizer.cache.target-size-mb

property.description: Number of threads to handle localization requests.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.localizer.client.thread-count

property.description: Number of threads to use for localization fetching.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.localizer.fetch.thread-count

property.description: Where to store container logs. An application's localized log directory will be found in ${yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs}/application_${appid}. Individual containers' log directories will be below this, in directories named container_{$contid}. Each container directory will contain the files stderr, stdin, and syslog generated by that container.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs

property.description: The permissions settings used for the creation of container directories when using DefaultContainerExecutor. This follows standard user/group/all permissions format.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.default-container-executor.log-dirs.permissions

property.description: Whether to enable log aggregation. Log aggregation collects each container's logs and moves these logs onto a file-system, for e.g. HDFS, after the application completes. Users can configure the "yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir" and "yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir-suffix" properties to determine where these logs are moved to. Users can access the logs via the Application Timeline Server.
property.name: yarn.log-aggregation-enable

property.description: How long to keep aggregation logs before deleting them. -1 disables. Be careful set this too small and you will spam the name node.
property.name: yarn.log-aggregation.retain-seconds

property.description: How long to wait between aggregated log retention checks. If set to 0 or a negative value then the value is computed as one-tenth of the aggregated log retention time. Be careful set this too small and you will spam the name node.
property.name: yarn.log-aggregation.retain-check-interval-seconds

property.description: Specify which log file controllers we will support. The first file controller we add will be used to write the aggregated logs. This comma separated configuration will work with the configuration: yarn.log-aggregation.file-controller.%s.class which defines the supported file controller's class. By default, the TFile controller would be used. The user could override this configuration by adding more file controllers. To support back-ward compatibility, make sure that we always add TFile file controller.
property.name: yarn.log-aggregation.file-formats

property.description: Class that supports TFile read and write operations.
property.name: yarn.log-aggregation.file-controller.TFile.class

property.description: How long for ResourceManager to wait for NodeManager to report its log aggregation status. If waiting time of which the log aggregation status is reported from NodeManager exceeds the configured value, RM will report log aggregation status for this NodeManager as TIME_OUT
property.name: yarn.log-aggregation-status.time-out.ms

property.description: Time in seconds to retain user logs. Only applicable if log aggregation is disabled
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log.retain-seconds

property.description: Where to aggregate logs to.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir

property.description: The remote log dir will be created at {yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir}/${user}/{thisParam}
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir-suffix

property.description: Generate additional logs about container launches. Currently, this creates a copy of the launch script and lists the directory contents of the container work dir. When listing directory contents, we follow symlinks to a max-depth of 5(including symlinks which point to outside the container work dir) which may lead to a slowness in launching containers.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log-container-debug-info.enabled

property.description: Amount of physical memory, in MB, that can be allocated for containers. If set to -1 and yarn.nodemanager.resource.detect-hardware-capabilities is true, it is automatically calculated(in case of Windows and Linux). In other cases, the default is 8192MB.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource.memory-mb

property.description: Amount of physical memory, in MB, that is reserved for non-YARN processes. This configuration is only used if yarn.nodemanager.resource.detect-hardware-capabilities is set to true and yarn.nodemanager.resource.memory-mb is -1. If set to -1, this amount is calculated as 20% of (system memory - 2*HADOOP_HEAPSIZE)
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource.system-reserved-memory-mb

property.description: Whether physical memory limits will be enforced for containers.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.pmem-check-enabled

property.description: Whether virtual memory limits will be enforced for containers.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.vmem-check-enabled

property.description: Ratio between virtual memory to physical memory when setting memory limits for containers. Container allocations are expressed in terms of physical memory, and virtual memory usage is allowed to exceed this allocation by this ratio.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.vmem-pmem-ratio

property.description: Number of vcores that can be allocated for containers. This is used by the RM scheduler when allocating resources for containers. This is not used to limit the number of CPUs used by YARN containers. If it is set to -1 and yarn.nodemanager.resource.detect-hardware-capabilities is true, it is automatically determined from the hardware in case of Windows and Linux. In other cases, number of vcores is 8 by default.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource.cpu-vcores

property.description: Flag to determine if logical processors(such as hyperthreads) should be counted as cores. Only applicable on Linux when yarn.nodemanager.resource.cpu-vcores is set to -1 and yarn.nodemanager.resource.detect-hardware-capabilities is true.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource.count-logical-processors-as-cores

property.description: Multiplier to determine how to convert phyiscal cores to vcores. This value is used if yarn.nodemanager.resource.cpu-vcores is set to -1(which implies auto-calculate vcores) and yarn.nodemanager.resource.detect-hardware-capabilities is set to true. The number of vcores will be calculated as number of CPUs * multiplier.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource.pcores-vcores-multiplier

property.description: Thread pool size for LogAggregationService in Node Manager.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.logaggregation.threadpool-size-max

property.description: Percentage of CPU that can be allocated for containers. This setting allows users to limit the amount of CPU that YARN containers use. Currently functional only on Linux using cgroups. The default is to use 100% of CPU.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource.percentage-physical-cpu-limit

property.description: Enable auto-detection of node capabilities such as memory and CPU.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource.detect-hardware-capabilities

property.description: NM Webapp address.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.webapp.address

property.description: The https adddress of the NM web application.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.webapp.https.address

property.description: The Kerberos keytab file to be used for spnego filter for the NM web interface.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.webapp.spnego-keytab-file

property.description: The Kerberos principal to be used for spnego filter for the NM web interface.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.webapp.spnego-principal

property.description: How often to monitor the node and the containers. If 0 or negative, monitoring is disabled.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource-monitor.interval-ms

property.description: Class that calculates current resource utilization.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource-calculator.class

property.description: Enable container monitor
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-monitor.enabled

property.description: How often to monitor containers. If not set, the value for yarn.nodemanager.resource-monitor.interval-ms will be used. If 0 or negative, container monitoring is disabled.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-monitor.interval-ms

property.description: Class that calculates containers current resource utilization. If not set, the value for yarn.nodemanager.resource-calculator.class will be used.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-monitor.resource-calculator.class

property.description: Frequency of running node health script.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.health-checker.interval-ms

property.description: Script time out period.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.health-checker.script.timeout-ms

property.description: The health check script to run.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.health-checker.script.path

property.description: The arguments to pass to the health check script.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.health-checker.script.opts

property.description: Frequency of running disk health checker code.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.interval-ms

property.description: The minimum fraction of number of disks to be healthy for the nodemanager to launch new containers. This correspond to both yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs and yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs. i.e. If there are less number of healthy local-dirs (or log-dirs) available, then new containers will not be launched on this node.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.min-healthy-disks

property.description: The maximum percentage of disk space utilization allowed after which a disk is marked as bad. Values can range from 0.0 to 100.0. If the value is greater than or equal to 100, the nodemanager will check for full disk. This applies to yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs and yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.max-disk-utilization-per-disk-percentage

property.description: The low threshold percentage of disk space used when a bad disk is marked as good. Values can range from 0.0 to 100.0. This applies to yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs and yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs. Note that if its value is more than yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker. max-disk-utilization-per-disk-percentage or not set, it will be set to the same value as yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.max-disk-utilization-per-disk-percentage.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.disk-utilization-watermark-low-per-disk-percentage

property.description: The minimum space that must be available on a disk for it to be used. This applies to yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs and yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.min-free-space-per-disk-mb

property.description: The path to the Linux container executor.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.path

property.description: The class which should help the LCE handle resources.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.resources-handler.class

property.description: The cgroups hierarchy under which to place YARN proccesses (cannot contain commas). If yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.cgroups.mount is false (that is, if cgroups have been pre-configured) and the YARN user has write access to the parent directory, then the directory will be created. If the directory already exists, the administrator has to give YARN write permissions to it recursively. This property only applies when the LCE resources handler is set to CgroupsLCEResourcesHandler.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.cgroups.hierarchy

property.description: Whether the LCE should attempt to mount cgroups if not found. This property only applies when the LCE resources handler is set to CgroupsLCEResourcesHandler.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.cgroups.mount

property.description:
This property sets the path from which YARN will read the CGroups configuration. YARN has built-in functionality to discover the system CGroup mount paths, so use this property only if YARN's automatic mount path discovery does not work.
The path specified by this property must exist before the NodeManager is launched. If yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.cgroups.mount is set to true, YARN will first try to mount the CGroups at the specified path before reading them. If yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.cgroups.mount is set to false, YARN will read the CGroups at the specified path. If this property is empty, YARN tries to detect the CGroups location.
Please refer to NodeManagerCgroups.html in the documentation for further details. This property only applies when the LCE resources handler is set to CgroupsLCEResourcesHandler.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.cgroups.mount-path

property.description: Delay in ms between attempts to remove linux cgroup
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.cgroups.delete-delay-ms

property.description: This determines which of the two modes that LCE should use on a non-secure cluster. If this value is set to true, then all containers will be launched as the user specified in yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.nonsecure-mode.local-user. If this value is set to false, then containers will run as the user who submitted the application.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.nonsecure-mode.limit-users

property.description: The UNIX user that containers will run as when Linux-container-executor is used in nonsecure mode (a use case for this is using cgroups) if the yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.nonsecure-mode.limit-users is set to true.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.nonsecure-mode.local-user

property.description: The allowed pattern for UNIX user names enforced by Linux-container-executor when used in nonsecure mode (use case for this is using cgroups). The default value is taken from /usr/sbin/adduser
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.nonsecure-mode.user-pattern

property.description: This flag determines whether apps should run with strict resource limits or be allowed to consume spare resources if they need them. For example, turning the flag on will restrict apps to use only their share of CPU, even if the node has spare CPU cycles. The default value is false i.e. use available resources. Please note that turning this flag on may reduce job throughput on the cluster.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.cgroups.strict-resource-usage

property.description: Comma separated list of runtimes that are allowed when using LinuxContainerExecutor. The allowed values are default and docker.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.allowed-runtimes

property.description: This configuration setting determines the capabilities assigned to docker containers when they are launched. While these may not be case-sensitive from a docker perspective, it is best to keep these uppercase. To run without any capabilites, set this value to "none" or "NONE"
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.capabilities

property.description: This configuration setting determines if privileged docker containers are allowed on this cluster. Use with extreme care.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.privileged-containers.allowed

property.description: This configuration setting determines who is allowed to run privileged docker containers on this cluster. Use with extreme care.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.privileged-containers.acl

property.description: The set of networks allowed when launching containers using the DockerContainerRuntime.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.allowed-container-networks

property.description: The network used when launching containers using the DockerContainerRuntime when no network is specified in the request . This network must be one of the (configurable) set of allowed container networks.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.default-container-network

property.description: Property to enable docker user remapping
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.enable-userremapping.allowed

property.description: lower limit for acceptable uids of user remapped user
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.userremapping-uid-threshold

property.description: lower limit for acceptable gids of user remapped user
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.userremapping-gid-threshold

property.description: This flag determines whether memory limit will be set for the Windows Job Object of the containers launched by the default container executor.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.windows-container.memory-limit.enabled

property.description: This flag determines whether CPU limit will be set for the Windows Job Object of the containers launched by the default container executor.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.windows-container.cpu-limit.enabled

property.description: Interval of time the linux container executor should try cleaning up cgroups entry when cleaning up a container.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.cgroups.delete-timeout-ms

property.description: The UNIX group that the linux-container-executor should run as.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.group

property.description: T-file compression types used to compress aggregated logs.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log-aggregation.compression-type

property.description: The kerberos principal for the node manager.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.principal

property.description: A comma separated list of services where service name should only contain a-zA-Z0-9_ and can not start with numbers
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.aux-services

property.description: No. of ms to wait between sending a SIGTERM and SIGKILL to a container
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.sleep-delay-before-sigkill.ms

property.description: Max time to wait for a process to come up when trying to cleanup a container
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.process-kill-wait.ms

property.description: The minimum allowed version of a resourcemanager that a nodemanager will connect to. The valid values are NONE (no version checking), EqualToNM (the resourcemanager's version is equal to or greater than the NM version), or a Version String.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resourcemanager.minimum.version

property.description: Maximum size of contain's diagnostics to keep for relaunching container case.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-diagnostics-maximum-size

property.description: Minimum container restart interval in milliseconds.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-retry-minimum-interval-ms

property.description: Max number of threads in NMClientAsync to process container management events
property.name: yarn.client.nodemanager-client-async.thread-pool-max-size

property.description: Max time to wait to establish a connection to NM
property.name: yarn.client.nodemanager-connect.max-wait-ms

property.description: Time interval between each attempt to connect to NM
property.name: yarn.client.nodemanager-connect.retry-interval-ms

property.description: Max time to wait for NM to connect to RM. When not set, proxy will fall back to use value of yarn.resourcemanager.connect.max-wait.ms.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resourcemanager.connect.max-wait.ms

property.description: Time interval between each NM attempt to connect to RM. When not set, proxy will fall back to use value of yarn.resourcemanager.connect.retry-interval.ms.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resourcemanager.connect.retry-interval.ms

property.description: Maximum number of proxy connections to cache for node managers. If set to a value greater than zero then the cache is enabled and the NMClient and MRAppMaster will cache the specified number of node manager proxies. There will be at max one proxy per node manager. Ex. configuring it to a value of 5 will make sure that client will at max have 5 proxies cached with 5 different node managers. These connections for these proxies will be timed out if idle for more than the system wide idle timeout period. Note that this could cause issues on large clusters as many connections could linger simultaneously and lead to a large number of connection threads. The token used for authentication will be used only at connection creation time. If a new token is received then the earlier connection should be closed in order to use the new token. This and (yarn.client.nodemanager-client-async.thread-pool-max-size) are related and should be in sync (no need for them to be equal). If the value of this property is zero then the connection cache is disabled and connections will use a zero idle timeout to prevent too many connection threads on large clusters.
property.name: yarn.client.max-cached-nodemanagers-proxies

property.description: Enable the node manager to recover after starting
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.recovery.enabled

property.description: The local filesystem directory in which the node manager will store state when recovery is enabled.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.recovery.dir

property.description: The time in seconds between full compactions of the NM state database. Setting the interval to zero disables the full compaction cycles.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.recovery.compaction-interval-secs

property.description: Whether the nodemanager is running under supervision. A nodemanager that supports recovery and is running under supervision will not try to cleanup containers as it exits with the assumption it will be immediately be restarted and recover containers.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.recovery.supervised

property.description: Adjustment to the container OS scheduling priority. In Linux, passed directly to the nice command. If unspecified then containers are launched without any explicit OS priority.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-executor.os.sched.priority.adjustment

property.description: Flag to enable container metrics
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-metrics.enable

property.description: Container metrics flush period in ms. Set to -1 for flush on completion.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-metrics.period-ms

property.description: The delay time ms to unregister container metrics after completion.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-metrics.unregister-delay-ms

property.description: Class used to calculate current container resource utilization.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-monitor.process-tree.class

property.description: Flag to enable NodeManager disk health checker
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.enable

property.description: Number of threads to use in NM log cleanup. Used when log aggregation is disabled.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log.deletion-threads-count

property.description: The Windows group that the windows-container-executor should run as.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.windows-secure-container-executor.group
yarn.nodemanager.docker-container-executor.exec-name
property.description: Name or path to the Docker client.
The Docker image name to use for DockerContainerExecutor
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.docker-container-executor.image-name

property.description: The kerberos principal for the proxy, if the proxy is not running as part of the RM.
property.name: yarn.web-proxy.principal

property.description: Keytab for WebAppProxy, if the proxy is not running as part of the RM.
property.name: yarn.web-proxy.keytab

property.description: The address for the web proxy as HOST:PORT, if this is not given then the proxy will run as part of the RM
property.name: yarn.web-proxy.address

property.description: CLASSPATH for YARN applications. A comma-separated list of CLASSPATH entries. When this value is empty, the following default CLASSPATH for YARN applications would be used. For Linux: $HADOOP_CONF_DIR, $HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/share/hadoop/common/*, $HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/share/hadoop/common/lib/*, $HADOOP_HDFS_HOME/share/hadoop/hdfs/*, $HADOOP_HDFS_HOME/share/hadoop/hdfs/lib/*, $HADOOP_YARN_HOME/share/hadoop/yarn/*, $HADOOP_YARN_HOME/share/hadoop/yarn/lib/* For Windows: %HADOOP_CONF_DIR%, %HADOOP_COMMON_HOME%/share/hadoop/common/*, %HADOOP_COMMON_HOME%/share/hadoop/common/lib/*, %HADOOP_HDFS_HOME%/share/hadoop/hdfs/*, %HADOOP_HDFS_HOME%/share/hadoop/hdfs/lib/*, %HADOOP_YARN_HOME%/share/hadoop/yarn/*, %HADOOP_YARN_HOME%/share/hadoop/yarn/lib/*
property.name: yarn.application.classpath

property.description: Indicate what is the current version of the running timeline service. For example, if "yarn.timeline-service.version" is 1.5, and "yarn.timeline-service.enabled" is true, it means the cluster will and should bring up the timeline service v.1.5 (and nothing else). On the client side, if the client uses the same version of timeline service, it should succeed. If the client chooses to use a smaller version in spite of this, then depending on how robust the compatibility story is between versions, the results may vary.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.version

property.description: In the server side it indicates whether timeline service is enabled or not. And in the client side, users can enable it to indicate whether client wants to use timeline service. If it's enabled in the client side along with security, then yarn client tries to fetch the delegation tokens for the timeline server.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.enabled

property.description: The hostname of the timeline service web application.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.hostname

property.description: This is default address for the timeline server to start the RPC server.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.address

property.description: The http address of the timeline service web application.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.webapp.address

property.description: The https address of the timeline service web application.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.webapp.https.address

property.description: The actual address the server will bind to. If this optional address is set, the RPC and webapp servers will bind to this address and the port specified in yarn.timeline-service.address and yarn.timeline-service.webapp.address, respectively. This is most useful for making the service listen to all interfaces by setting to 0.0.0.0.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.bind-host

property.description: Defines the max number of applications could be fetched using REST API or application history protocol and shown in timeline server web ui.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.generic-application-history.max-applications

property.description: Store class name for timeline store.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.store-class

property.description: Enable age off of timeline store data.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.ttl-enable

property.description: Time to live for timeline store data in milliseconds.

property.description: Store file name for leveldb timeline store.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.leveldb-timeline-store.path

property.description: Length of time to wait between deletion cycles of leveldb timeline store in milliseconds.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.leveldb-timeline-store.ttl-interval-ms

property.description: Size of read cache for uncompressed blocks for leveldb timeline store in bytes.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.leveldb-timeline-store.read-cache-size

property.description: Size of cache for recently read entity start times for leveldb timeline store in number of entities.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.leveldb-timeline-store.start-time-read-cache-size

property.description: Size of cache for recently written entity start times for leveldb timeline store in number of entities.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.leveldb-timeline-store.start-time-write-cache-size

property.description: Handler thread count to serve the client RPC requests.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.handler-thread-count
yarn.timeline-service.http-authentication.type
property.description: Defines authentication used for the timeline server HTTP endpoint. Supported values are: simple | kerberos | #AUTHENTICATION_HANDLER_CLASSNAME#

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.http-authentication.simple.anonymous.allowed
property.description: Indicates if anonymous requests are allowed by the timeline server when using 'simple' authentication.
The Kerberos principal for the timeline server.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.principal

property.description: The Kerberos keytab for the timeline server.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.keytab

property.description: Comma separated list of UIs that will be hosted
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.ui-names

property.description: Default maximum number of retries for timeline service client and value -1 means no limit.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.client.max-retries

property.description: Client policy for whether timeline operations are non-fatal. Should the failure to obtain a delegation token be considered an application failure (option = false), or should the client attempt to continue to publish information without it (option=true)
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.client.best-effort

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.client.drain-entities.timeout.ms

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.leveldb-state-store.path
yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.cache-store-class
property.description: Caching storage timeline server v1.5 is using.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.active-dir
property.description: HDFS path to store active application’s timeline data

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.done-dir
property.description: HDFS path to store done application’s timeline data

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.group-id-plugin-classes
property.description: Plugins that can translate a timeline entity read request into a list of timeline entity group ids, separated by commas.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.group-id-plugin-classpath
property.description: Classpath for all plugins defined in yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.group-id-plugin-classes.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.summary-store
property.description: Summary storage for ATS v1.5

property.description: Scan interval for ATS v1.5 entity group file system storage reader.This value controls how frequent the reader will scan the HDFS active directory for application status.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.cleaner-interval-seconds
property.description: Scan interval for ATS v1.5 entity group file system storage cleaner.This value controls how frequent the reader will scan the HDFS done directory for stale application data.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.retain-seconds
property.description: How long the ATS v1.5 entity group file system storage will keep an application's data in the done directory.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.leveldb-cache-read-cache-size
property.description: Read cache size for the leveldb cache storage in ATS v1.5 plugin storage.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.app-cache-size
property.description: Size of the reader cache for ATS v1.5 reader. This value controls how many entity groups the ATS v1.5 server should cache. If the number of active read entity groups is greater than the number of caches items, some reads may return empty data. This value must be greater than 0.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.client.fd-flush-interval-secs
property.description: Flush interval for ATS v1.5 writer. This value controls how frequent the writer will flush the HDFS FSStream for the entity/domain.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.client.fd-clean-interval-secs
property.description: Scan interval for ATS v1.5 writer. This value controls how frequent the writer will scan the HDFS FSStream for the entity/domain. If the FSStream is stale for a long time, this FSStream will be close.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.client.fd-retain-secs
property.description: How long the ATS v1.5 writer will keep an FSStream open. If this fsstream does not write anything for this configured time, it will be close.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.writer.class
property.description: Storage implementation ATS v2 will use for the TimelineWriter service.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.reader.class
property.description: Storage implementation ATS v2 will use for the TimelineReader service.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.client.internal-timers-ttl-secs
property.description: How long the internal Timer Tasks can be alive in writer. If there is no write operation for this configured time, the internal timer tasks will be close.
The setting that controls how often the timeline collector flushes the timeline writer.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.writer.flush-interval-seconds

property.description: Time period till which the application collector will be alive in NM, after the application master container finishes.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.app-collector.linger-period.ms

property.description: Time line V2 client tries to merge these many number of async entities (if available) and then call the REST ATS V2 API to submit.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.timeline-client.number-of-async-entities-to-merge

property.description: The setting that controls how long the final value of a metric of a completed app is retained before merging into the flow sum. Up to this time after an application is completed out-of-order values that arrive can be recognized and discarded at the cost of increased storage.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.hbase.coprocessor.app-final-value-retention-milliseconds

property.description: The default hdfs location for flowrun coprocessor jar.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.hbase.coprocessor.jar.hdfs.location

property.description: The value of this parameter sets the prefix for all tables that are part of timeline service in the hbase storage schema. It can be set to "dev." or "staging." if it is to be used for development or staging instances. This way the data in production tables stays in a separate set of tables prefixed by "prod.".
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.hbase-schema.prefix

property.description: Optional URL to an hbase-site.xml configuration file to be used to connect to the timeline-service hbase cluster. If empty or not specified, then the HBase configuration will be loaded from the classpath. When specified the values in the specified configuration file will override those from the ones that are present on the classpath.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.hbase.configuration.file

property.description: Whether the shared cache is enabled
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.enabled

property.description: The root directory for the shared cache
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.root-dir

property.description: The level of nested directories before getting to the checksum directories. It must be non-negative.
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.nested-level

property.description: The implementation to be used for the SCM store
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.store.class

property.description: The implementation to be used for the SCM app-checker
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.app-checker.class

property.description: A resource in the in-memory store is considered stale if the time since the last reference exceeds the staleness period. This value is specified in minutes.
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.store.in-memory.staleness-period-mins

property.description: Initial delay before the in-memory store runs its first check to remove dead initial applications. Specified in minutes.
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.store.in-memory.initial-delay-mins

property.description: The frequency at which the in-memory store checks to remove dead initial applications. Specified in minutes.
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.store.in-memory.check-period-mins

property.description: The address of the admin interface in the SCM (shared cache manager)
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.admin.address

property.description: The number of threads used to handle SCM admin interface (1 by default)
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.admin.thread-count

property.description: The address of the web application in the SCM (shared cache manager)

property.description: The frequency at which a cleaner task runs. Specified in minutes.
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.cleaner.period-mins

property.description: Initial delay before the first cleaner task is scheduled. Specified in minutes.
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.cleaner.initial-delay-mins

property.description: The time to sleep between processing each shared cache resource. Specified in milliseconds.
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.cleaner.resource-sleep-ms

property.description: The address of the node manager interface in the SCM (shared cache manager)
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.uploader.server.address

property.description: The number of threads used to handle shared cache manager requests from the node manager (50 by default)
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.uploader.server.thread-count

property.description: The address of the client interface in the SCM (shared cache manager)
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.client-server.address

property.description: The number of threads used to handle shared cache manager requests from clients (50 by default)
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.client-server.thread-count

property.description: The algorithm used to compute checksums of files (SHA-256 by default)
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.checksum.algo.impl

property.description: The replication factor for the node manager uploader for the shared cache (10 by default)
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.nm.uploader.replication.factor

property.description: The number of threads used to upload files from a node manager instance (20 by default)
property.name: yarn.sharedcache.nm.uploader.thread-count

property.description: ACL protocol for use in the Timeline server.
property.name: security.applicationhistory.protocol.acl

property.description: Set to true for MiniYARNCluster unit tests
property.name: yarn.is.minicluster

property.description: Set for MiniYARNCluster unit tests to control resource monitoring
property.name: yarn.minicluster.control-resource-monitoring

property.description: Set to false in order to allow MiniYARNCluster to run tests without port conflicts.
property.name: yarn.minicluster.fixed.ports

property.description: Set to false in order to allow the NodeManager in MiniYARNCluster to use RPC to talk to the RM.
property.name: yarn.minicluster.use-rpc

property.description: As yarn.nodemanager.resource.memory-mb property but for the NodeManager in a MiniYARNCluster.
property.name: yarn.minicluster.yarn.nodemanager.resource.memory-mb

property.description: Enable node labels feature
property.name: yarn.node-labels.enabled

property.description: Retry policy used for FileSystem node label store. The policy is specified by N pairs of sleep-time in milliseconds and number-of-retries "s1,n1,s2,n2,...".
property.name: yarn.node-labels.fs-store.retry-policy-spec

property.description: URI for NodeLabelManager. The default value is /tmp/hadoop-yarn-${user}/node-labels/ in the local filesystem.
property.name: yarn.node-labels.fs-store.root-dir

property.description: Set configuration type for node labels. Administrators can specify "centralized", "delegated-centralized" or "distributed".
property.name: yarn.node-labels.configuration-type

property.description: When "yarn.node-labels.configuration-type" is configured with "distributed" in RM, Administrators can configure in NM the provider for the node labels by configuring this parameter. Administrators can configure "config", "script" or the class name of the provider. Configured class needs to extend org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.nodemanager.nodelabels.NodeLabelsProvider. If "config" is configured, then "ConfigurationNodeLabelsProvider" and if "script" is configured, then "ScriptNodeLabelsProvider" will be used.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.node-labels.provider

property.description: When "yarn.nodemanager.node-labels.provider" is configured with "config", "Script" or the configured class extends AbstractNodeLabelsProvider, then periodically node labels are retrieved from the node labels provider. This configuration is to define the interval period. If -1 is configured then node labels are retrieved from provider only during initialization. Defaults to 10 mins.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.node-labels.provider.fetch-interval-ms

property.description: Interval at which NM syncs its node labels with RM. NM will send its loaded labels every x intervals configured, along with heartbeat to RM.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.node-labels.resync-interval-ms

property.description: When "yarn.nodemanager.node-labels.provider" is configured with "config" then ConfigurationNodeLabelsProvider fetches the partition label from this parameter.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.node-labels.provider.configured-node-partition

property.description: When "yarn.nodemanager.node-labels.provider" is configured with "Script" then this configuration provides the timeout period after which it will interrupt the script which queries the Node labels. Defaults to 20 mins.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.node-labels.provider.fetch-timeout-ms

property.description: When node labels "yarn.node-labels.configuration-type" is of type "delegated-centralized", administrators should configure the class for fetching node labels by ResourceManager. Configured class needs to extend org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.nodelabels. RMNodeLabelsMappingProvider.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.node-labels.provider

property.description: When "yarn.node-labels.configuration-type" is configured with "delegated-centralized", then periodically node labels are retrieved from the node labels provider. This configuration is to define the interval. If -1 is configured then node labels are retrieved from provider only once for each node after it registers. Defaults to 30 mins.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.node-labels.provider.fetch-interval-ms

property.description: Timeout in seconds for YARN node graceful decommission. This is the maximal time to wait for running containers and applications to complete before transition a DECOMMISSIONING node into DECOMMISSIONED.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.nodemanager-graceful-decommission-timeout-secs

property.description: Timeout in seconds of DecommissioningNodesWatcher internal polling.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.decommissioning-nodes-watcher.poll-interval-secs

property.description: The Node Label script to run. Script output Line starting with "NODE_PARTITION:" will be considered as Node Label Partition. In case of multiple lines have this pattern, then last one will be considered
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.node-labels.provider.script.path

property.description: The arguments to pass to the Node label script.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.node-labels.provider.script.opts

property.description: Flag to indicate whether the RM is participating in Federation or not.
property.name: yarn.federation.enabled

property.description: Machine list file to be loaded by the FederationSubCluster Resolver
property.name: yarn.federation.machine-list

property.description: Class name for SubClusterResolver
property.name: yarn.federation.subcluster-resolver.class

property.description: Store class name for federation state store
property.name: yarn.federation.state-store.class

property.description: The time in seconds after which the federation state store local cache will be refreshed periodically
property.name: yarn.federation.cache-ttl.secs

property.description: The registry base directory for federation.
property.name: yarn.federation.registry.base-dir

property.description: The registry implementation to use.
property.name: yarn.registry.class

property.description: The interval that the yarn client library uses to poll the completion status of the asynchronous API of application client protocol.
property.name: yarn.client.application-client-protocol.poll-interval-ms

property.description: The duration (in ms) the YARN client waits for an expected state change to occur. -1 means unlimited wait time.
property.name: yarn.client.application-client-protocol.poll-timeout-ms

property.description: RSS usage of a process computed via /proc/pid/stat is not very accurate as it includes shared pages of a process. /proc/pid/smaps provides useful information like Private_Dirty, Private_Clean, Shared_Dirty, Shared_Clean which can be used for computing more accurate RSS. When this flag is enabled, RSS is computed as Min(Shared_Dirty, Pss) + Private_Clean + Private_Dirty. It excludes read-only shared mappings in RSS computation.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-monitor.procfs-tree.smaps-based-rss.enabled

property.description: URL for log aggregation server
property.name: yarn.log.server.url

property.description: URL for log aggregation server web service
property.name: yarn.log.server.web-service.url

property.description: RM Application Tracking URL
property.name: yarn.tracking.url.generator

property.description: Class to be used for YarnAuthorizationProvider
property.name: yarn.authorization-provider

property.description: Defines how often NMs wake up to upload log files. The default value is -1. By default, the logs will be uploaded when the application is finished. By setting this configure, logs can be uploaded periodically when the application is running. The minimum rolling-interval-seconds can be set is 3600.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log-aggregation.roll-monitoring-interval-seconds

property.description: Enable/disable intermediate-data encryption at YARN level. For now, this only is used by the FileSystemRMStateStore to setup right file-system security attributes.
property.name: yarn.intermediate-data-encryption.enable

property.description: Flag to enable cross-origin (CORS) support in the NM. This flag requires the CORS filter initializer to be added to the filter initializers list in core-site.xml.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.webapp.cross-origin.enabled

property.description: Defines maximum application priority in a cluster. If an application is submitted with a priority higher than this value, it will be reset to this maximum value.
property.name: yarn.cluster.max-application-priority

property.description: The default log aggregation policy class. Applications can override it via LogAggregationContext. This configuration can provide some cluster-side default behavior so that if the application doesn't specify any policy via LogAggregationContext administrators of the cluster can adjust the policy globally.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log-aggregation.policy.class

property.description: The default parameters for the log aggregation policy. Applications can override it via LogAggregationContext. This configuration can provide some cluster-side default behavior so that if the application doesn't specify any policy via LogAggregationContext administrators of the cluster can adjust the policy globally.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log-aggregation.policy.parameters

property.description: Enable/Disable AMRMProxyService in the node manager. This service is used to intercept calls from the application masters to the resource manager.

property.description: Whether AMRMProxy HA is enabled.

property.description: Setting that controls whether distributed scheduling is enabled.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.distributed-scheduling.enabled

property.description: Frequency for computing least loaded NMs.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.nm-container-queuing.load-comparator

property.description: Use container pause as the preemption policy over kill in the container queue at a NodeManager.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.opportunistic-containers-use-pause-for-preemption

property.description: Error filename pattern, to identify the file in the container's Log directory which contain the container's error log. As error file redirection is done by client/AM and yarn will not be aware of the error file name. YARN uses this pattern to identify the error file and tail the error log as diagnostics when the container execution returns non zero value. Filename patterns are case sensitive and should match the specifications of FileSystem.globStatus(Path) api. If multiple filenames matches the pattern, first file matching the pattern will be picked.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container.stderr.pattern

property.description: Size of the container error file which needs to be tailed, in bytes.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container.stderr.tail.bytes

property.description: Choose different implementation of node label's storage
property.name: yarn.node-labels.fs-store.impl.class

property.name: yarn.webapp.xfs-filter.enabled

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.webapp.xfs-filter.xframe-options

property.description: Property specifying the xframe options value.
property.name: yarn.nodemanager.webapp.xfs-filter.xframe-options

property.description: Property specifying the xframe options value.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.webapp.xfs-filter.xframe-options

property.description: The least amount of time(msec.) an inactive (decommissioned or shutdown) node can stay in the nodes list of the resourcemanager after being declared untracked. A node is marked untracked if and only if it is absent from both include and exclude nodemanager lists on the RM. All inactive nodes are checked twice per timeout interval or every 10 minutes, whichever is lesser, and marked appropriately. The same is done when refreshNodes command (graceful or otherwise) is invoked.
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.node-removal-untracked.timeout-ms

property.description: The RMAppLifetimeMonitor Service uses this value as monitor interval
property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.application-timeouts.monitor.interval-ms

property.description: Defines the limit of the diagnostics message of an application attempt, in kilo characters (character count * 1024). When using ZooKeeper to store application state behavior, it's important to limit the size of the diagnostic messages to prevent YARN from overwhelming ZooKeeper. In cases where yarn.resourcemanager.state-store.max-completed-applications is set to a large number, it may be desirable to reduce the value of this property to limit the total data stored.
property.name: yarn.app.attempt.diagnostics.limit.kc

property.description: Flag to enable cross-origin (CORS) support for timeline service v1.x or Timeline Reader in timeline service v2. For timeline service v2, also add org.apache.hadoop.security.HttpCrossOriginFilterInitializer to the configuration hadoop.http.filter.initializers in core-site.xml.
property.name: yarn.timeline-service.http-cross-origin.enabled

property.description: Comma-separated list of PlacementRules to determine how applications submitted by certain users get mapped to certain queues. Default is user-group, which corresponds to UserGroupMappingPlacementRule.
property.name: yarn.scheduler.queue-placement-rules
yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.with-user-dir

property.description: The comma separated list of class names that implement the RequestInterceptor interface. This is used by the RouterClientRMService to create the request processing pipeline for users.

property.description: Size of LRU cache for Router ClientRM Service and RMAdmin Service.
property.name: yarn.router.pipeline.cache-max-size

property.description: The comma separated list of class names that implement the RequestInterceptor interface. This is used by the RouterRMAdminService to create the request processing pipeline for users.
property.name: yarn.router.rmadmin.interceptor-class.pipeline

property.description: The actual address the server will bind to. If this optional address is set, the RPC and webapp servers will bind to this address and the port specified in yarn.router.address and yarn.router.webapp.address, respectively. This is most useful for making Router listen to all interfaces by setting to 0.0.0.0.
property.name: yarn.router.bind-host

property.description: The comma separated list of class names that implement the RequestInterceptor interface. This is used by the RouterWebServices to create the request processing pipeline for users.
property.name: yarn.router.webapp.interceptor-class.pipeline

property.description: The http address of the Router web application. If only a host is provided as the value, the webapp will be served on a random port.
property.name: yarn.router.webapp.address

property.name: yarn.router.webapp.https.address
yarn.resourcemanager.display.per-user-apps
property.description: Flag to enable display of applications per user as an admin configuration.

The type of configuration store to use for scheduler configurations. Default is "file", which uses file based capacity-scheduler.xml to retrieve and change scheduler configuration. To enable API based scheduler configuration, use either "memory" (in memory storage, no persistence across restarts), "leveldb" (leveldb based storage), or "zk" (zookeeper based storage). API based configuration is only useful when using a scheduler which supports mutable configuration. Currently only capacity scheduler supports this.
property.name: yarn.scheduler.configuration.store.class

property.description: The class to use for configuration mutation ACL policy if using a mutable configuration provider. Controls whether a mutation request is allowed. The DefaultConfigurationMutationACLPolicy checks if the requestor is a YARN admin.
property.name: yarn.scheduler.configuration.mutation.acl-policy.class

property.description: The storage path for LevelDB implementation of configuration store, when yarn.scheduler.configuration.store.class is configured to be "leveldb".
property.name: yarn.scheduler.configuration.leveldb-store.path

property.description: The compaction interval for LevelDB configuration store in secs, when yarn.scheduler.configuration.store.class is configured to be "leveldb". Default is one day.
property.name: yarn.scheduler.configuration.leveldb-store.compaction-interval-secs

property.description: The max number of configuration change log entries kept in config store, when yarn.scheduler.configuration.store.class is configured to be "leveldb" or "zk". Default is 1000 for either.
property.name: yarn.scheduler.configuration.store.max-logs

property.description: ZK root node path for configuration store when using zookeeper-based configuration store.
property.name: yarn.scheduler.configuration.zk-store.parent-path
